availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Purdy (Marion County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha J. McAllister Purdy. Father of Richard Purdy, Leonard Purdy, Kittie Purdy, Logan Purdy, Samuel Purdy, Thompson Purdy, George L. Purdy, and Lydia E. Purdy. Farmer in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Marion County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860. Farmer in Marion County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 1, p. 346 B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 652.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 491B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Bradfordsville, p. 8B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994047, Marion County Births, p. 3.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Marion County, KY, September 1863, p. 150.
"William Thompson Purdy (1823-1907)," Find A Grave, Memorial #23769806, accessed December 16, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/23769806.
